## Mod.transaction() method

Perform a set of synchronous modifications in an explicit transaction. The transaction method is only needed if you want to be sure that a set of modifications are done as one transaction (one undo step). Modifications done outside of a transaction action callback will be grouped together in an implicit transaction.

<b>Signature:</b>

```typescript
transaction(action: () => void): void;
```

## Parameters

|  Parameter | Type | Description |
|  --- | --- | --- |
|  action | <code>() =&gt; void</code> | callback with a set of modifications |

<b>Returns:</b>

`void`

## Example


```
api.transaction(() => {
    api.mod.property("X").set("new value for X");
    api.mod.property("Y").set("new value for Y");
});

```
